definition: (lit.) a pot of porridge/(fig.) a complete mess
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
lit. a piece of rat feces spoiled the whole pot of congee (idiom)/fig. one bad apple can spoil the whole bunch
pinyin: yi1 li4 lao3 shu3 shi3 huai4 le5 yi1 guo1 zhou1
containing_words.word: 一粒老鼠屎坏了一锅粥

definition: see 一粒老鼠屎壞了一鍋粥|一粒老鼠屎坏了一锅粥[yi1 li4 lao3 shu3 shi3 huai4 le5 yi1 guo1 zhou1]
pinyin: yi1 ke1 lao3 shu3 shi3 huai4 le5 yi1 guo1 zhou1
containing_words.word: 一颗老鼠屎坏了一锅粥

sentences.english: Uncle Gen arrived at Old Wang's house to see everything was in a mess.
sentences.chinese: 根叔到老王家时，正乱成一锅粥。

sentences.english: From Shanghai, Wuhan, let alone anything difficult. New continents of Europe, let alone what has become a mess image.
sentences.chinese: 从新洲，到欧洲，别说什么事都乱成了一锅粥。

sentences.english: Foley scandal has messed up the whole Republican Party.
sentences.chinese: 弗利丑闻使整个共和党乱成了一锅粥。

sentences.english: In a monetary union, irresponsibility by one member endangers the well-being of others.
sentences.chinese: 在一个货币联盟内，一颗老鼠屎可以坏了一锅粥。

definition: noisy and in disarray/in an uproar
to mix/to blend/(fig.) to spoil/to mess up things/to run around with (sb)/to get involved with/to mix (with other people)
lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
to suffer a crushing defeat (idiom)/in a pitiful state/in a complete mess/to roll (with laughter)
billowing smoke (idiom)/foul atmosphere/(fig.) murky atmosphere/in a turmoil
